Description: Pottery model boat with flat base and pinched walls. Firecloud on one side.
Curator's comments: Hand formed from dense clay with small mineral inclusions and low organic component. Interior is a smooth curve. One end of the hull is more elongated than the other, but no other features are evident. This is one of two boat models found in cemetery 5100, and together they provide some of the earliest evidence for the importance of boats in the social and spiritual landscape of the Badarian period.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 6, 34)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
